Legal_Issue: Whether the Woolworth trademark was used by the registered owner during the relevant period
Evidence_Assessment: Affidavits provided sales figures and a photograph, but lacked explicit connection between trademark use and the registered owner
Burden_of_Proof: On the registered owner to demonstrate trademark use
Credibility_Factor: Lack of sufficient nexus between trademark use and registered owner
Legal_Rule: Use must be attributed to the registered owner or a licensee under Section 45
Standard_of_Review: Statutory interpretation and sufficiency of evidence
Procedural_Issue: Failure to establish required evidentiary link in response to Section 45 notice
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged lack of trademark use in Canada over three-year period
Outcome_on_Merits: Trademark expunged due to insufficient proof of use
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Dismissed with costs awarded to respondent
Review_Standard: Correctness or reasonableness, depending on context
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Proper procedure followed: notice, affidavits, hearing
Legal_Framework: Trade-marks Act, Canadian intellectual property law
Applicant_Challenge: Respondent challenged validity of registration based on non-use
Defendant_Response: Submitted affidavits showing use, but failed to prove ownership nexus
Evidence_Type: Affidavit evidence, documentary sales data, photographic evidence
Decision_Authority: Tribunal or court overseeing trademark appeals
Remedy_Sought: Removal of trademark from register due to non-use
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Non-use of trademark by registered owner
